file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 57-51-02-04 - SPOILER HINGING BRACKET - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SPOILER HINGING BRACKET - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove and install the ground-spoiler hinging brackets. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY GROUND-SPOILER HINGING BRACKETS ALL 57-51-02-000-801-A - REMOVAL GROUND-SPOILER HINGING BRACKETS ALL 57-51-02-400-801-A - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 57-51-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-51-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. GROUND-SPOILER HINGING BRACKETS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the ground-spoiler hinging brackets. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 27-62-05-000-801-A/400 GROUND SPOILER PANEL - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the ground-spoiler hinging bracket I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Remove the ground spoiler panel. Refer to AMM TASK 27-62-05-000-801-A/400. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the bolts (7), nuts (6), washers (4) and (5), and brackets (1), (2), and (3). D D GROUND-SPOILER HIGING BRACKET 2 (REF.) 3 4 3 DET. C 4 1 D D 4 1 4 6. NUT DET. B 2 4 GROUND-SPOILER 5. WASHER HINGING BRACKET (REF.) SPAR III (REF.) 4. WASHER 7. BOLT D-D (TYPICAL) 1 ON AIRCRAFT POST-MOD. S.B. 145-57-0044. APPLY TORQUE: 9.0 - 11.3 N.m (80 - 100 lb.in) PLUS LOCKING TORQUE 2 ON AIRCRAFT POST-MOD. S.B. 145-57-0044. APPLY TORQUE: 2.8 - 3.4 N.m (25 - 30 lb.in) PLUS LOCKING TORQUE 3 ON AIRCRAFT POST-MOD. S.B. 145-57-0044. APPLY TORQUE: 13.6 - 16.4 N.m (120 - 145 lb.in) PLUS LOCKING TORQUE 4 ON AIRCRAFT PRE-MOD. S.B. 145-57-0044. APPLY TORQUE AS GIVEN IN AMM PART II TASK 20-10-01/201 EM145AMM570137B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 57-51-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-51-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. GROUND-SPOILER HINGING BRACKETS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the ground-spoiler hinging brackets. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 20-10-01/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 27-62-05-400-801-A/400 GROUND SPOILER PANEL - INSTALLATION S.B.145-57-0044 - SRM 51-20-01/1 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-81733 Sealant, P/S 870 C-12 AR MEP09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone (MEK) AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the ground-spoiler hinging bracket EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-51-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE METHYL ETHYL KETONE (MEK) BECAUSE IT IS A HEALTH HAZARD (SKIN, EYES, OR MOUTH). DO NOT BREATHE ITS FUMES. KEEP IT AWAY FROM SPARKS, FLAMES, OR SOURCES OF HEAT. PUT ON APPROVED PROTECTIVE CLOTHING, GOGGLES, AND GLOVES. ALWAYS OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY PRECAUTIONS WHEN YOU USE MEK. IT IS POISONOUS AND FLAMMABLE. (1) Clean the interface areas of the ground-spoiler hinging bracket and spar III with Methyl Ethyl Ketone (MEK). (2) Apply interface sealant P/S 870 C-12 (SRM 51-20-01/1) to the bracket and spar-III faying area. WARNING: COR-BAN 27L CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE GLOVES. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (3) Apply COR-BAN 27L to the bolts (7). (4) Install the ground-spoiler hinging brackets (1), (2) and (3), bolts (7), washers (4) and (5), and nuts (6). (5) On aircraft PRE-MOD. S.B.145-57-0044, apply torque to nuts (6) as given in AMM MPP 20-10-01/200. (6) On aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-57-0044, apply torque as given in (Figure 401). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the ground spoiler panel. Refer to AMM TASK 27-62-05-400-801-A/400. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-51-02 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
